ch.zhaw.swen1.iotdisplay.platform

Interface Platform


  • public interface Platform
    Low level access to the platform, including hardware devices and outside connections. Because it is a thin wrapper around low level code, its design is just slightly object oriented.
    Author:
    fer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Display getDisplay()
      Returns the display of this platform or null if no display exists.
      java.nio.file.Path getPathForNames(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String... names)
      Returns a NIO (since Java 8) Path object for the specified name(s).
      SocketFactory getSocketFactory()
      Returns a socket factory.
      void setButtonEventListener(java.lang.String buttonName, EventListener listener)
      Sets the event listener which will be notified when the specified button is pressed.
      void setTimer4HzEventListener(EventListener listener)
      Sets the event listener which will be notified four times a second

    • Method Detail

      • getDisplay

        Display getDisplay()
        Returns the display of this platform or null if no display exists. If the (hardware) display cannot be changed, then the result is always the same and can be cached in the executable.
        Returns:
        Display

      • setButtonEventListener

        void setButtonEventListener(java.lang.String buttonName,
                            EventListener listener)
        Sets the event listener which will be notified when the specified button is pressed. Does nothing if no button with this name exists.
        Parameters:
        buttonName - of the button
        listener - object which will be notified

      • setTimer4HzEventListener

        void setTimer4HzEventListener(EventListener listener)
        Sets the event listener which will be notified four times a second
        Parameters:
        listener - object which will be notified

      • getSocketFactory

        SocketFactory getSocketFactory()
        Returns a socket factory. It is mandatory to use this factory to establish socket connections
        Returns:
        socket factory

      • getPathForNames

        java.nio.file.Path getPathForNames(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String... names)
        Returns a NIO (since Java 8) Path object for the specified name(s). The returned objects can then be used to access files with the help of the java.nio.file.Files class.
        Parameters:
        name - first part of the path
        names - optional additional path parts
        Returns:
        Path to access files
